segment.source: Monitoring MED-V Workspace Deployments
segment.target: Monitoring MED-V Workspace Deployments

segment.source: Monitoring MED-V Workspace Deployments
segment.target: Monitoring MED-V Workspace Deployments

segment.source: Monitoring MED-V Workspace Deployments
segment.target: Monitoring MED-V Workspace Deployments

segment.source: The monitoring feature in Microsoft Enterprise Desktop Virtualization (MED-V) 2.0 lets you run queries on individual MED-V workspaces to determine whether first time setup succeeded throughout your enterprise after the MED-V workspaces are deployed.
segment.target: The monitoring feature in Microsoft Enterprise Desktop Virtualization (MED-V) 2.0 lets you run queries on individual MED-V workspaces to determine whether first time setup succeeded throughout your enterprise after the MED-V workspaces are deployed.

segment.source: Monitoring the success of first time setup is important because MED-V is not in a usable state until first time setup has been completed successfully.
segment.target: Monitoring the success of first time setup is important because MED-V is not in a usable state until first time setup has been completed successfully.

segment.source: This section provides information and instruction to assist you in monitoring the success or failure of first time setup.
segment.target: This section provides information and instruction to assist you in monitoring the success or failure of first time setup.

segment.source: To monitor MED-V workspace deployments
segment.target: To monitor MED-V workspace deployments

segment.source: The monitoring feature consists of a coupled in-process Windows Management Instrumentation (WMI) provider that you can query using WMI Query Language to discover the status of first time setup for all end users on a MED-V workspace.
segment.target: The monitoring feature consists of a coupled in-process Windows Management Instrumentation (WMI) provider that you can query using WMI Query Language to discover the status of first time setup for all end users on a MED-V workspace.

segment.source: The WMI provider is implemented by using the WMI Provider Extension framework from the Microsoft .Net Framework 3.5.
segment.target: The WMI provider is implemented by using the WMI Provider Extension framework from the Microsoft .Net Framework 3.5.

segment.source: The WMI provider executes in the context of LocalService and stores the first time setup state securely under ProgramData.
segment.target: The WMI provider executes in the context of LocalService and stores the first time setup state securely under ProgramData.

segment.source: The WMI provider is implemented in the rootmicrosoftmedv namespace and implements the class FTSStatus, which exposes the method SetFtsState.
segment.target: The WMI provider is implemented in the rootmicrosoftmedv namespace and implements the class FTSStatus, which exposes the method SetFtsState.

segment.source: MED-V uses SetFtsState to set the first time setup state.
segment.target: MED-V uses SetFtsState to set the first time setup state.

segment.source: The class contains the following properties.
segment.target: The class contains the following properties.

segment.source: Property
segment.target: Property

segment.source: Description
segment.target: Description

segment.source: Machine
segment.target: Machine

segment.source: Read Only property that contains the name of the guest virtual machine provisioned by first time setup.
segment.target: Read Only property that contains the name of the guest virtual machine provisioned by first time setup.

segment.source: This key contains the name that the guest would have had on first time setup failure.
segment.target: This key contains the name that the guest would have had on first time setup failure.

segment.source: StatusCode
segment.target: StatusCode

segment.source: Read Only property that contains zero if first time setup succeeded.
segment.target: Read Only property that contains zero if first time setup succeeded.

segment.source: Any other value returned equals the event ID for the error that is logged.
segment.target: Any other value returned equals the event ID for the error that is logged.

segment.source: Time
segment.target: Time

segment.source: The UTC time that first time setup completed.
segment.target: The UTC time that first time setup completed.

segment.source: User
segment.target: User

segment.source: The user for which first time setup was run.
segment.target: The user for which first time setup was run.

segment.source: The following code shows the Managed Object Format (MOF) file that defines the FTSStatus class.
segment.target: The following code shows the Managed Object Format (MOF) file that defines the FTSStatus class.

segment.source: Because your main concern is most likely those MED-V workspaces for which first time setup was not completed successfully, you can write your query to only return those that failed first time setup, for example:
segment.target: Because your main concern is most likely those MED-V workspaces for which first time setup was not completed successfully, you can write your query to only return those that failed first time setup, for example:

segment.source: In this case, the monitoring feature returns a list of those MED-V workspaces that failed first time setup, which you can use to take the appropriate actions to resolve the failure.
segment.target: In this case, the monitoring feature returns a list of those MED-V workspaces that failed first time setup, which you can use to take the appropriate actions to resolve the failure.
